title: Sickness
data:
***Version [0.30](/0.30 "0.30")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

|   |                                                                    |
| - | ------------------------------------------------------------------ |
|   | You have been sickened, and your health will no longer regenerate. |

**Sickness** is a [status effect](/Status_effect "Status effect") that prevents characters from naturally regenerating [HP](/HP "HP") until it wears off. It does not affect [Trog](/Trog "Trog")'s Hand, [Jiyva](/Jiyva "Jiyva") regeneration, or [ambrosia](/Ambrosia "Ambrosia"). Other, non-regeneration sources of healing work normally.

## Sources

- Being within [line of sight](/Line_of_sight "Line of sight") of an [ancient zyme](/Ancient_zyme "Ancient zyme").

## Dealing with

**Immunity**

- [Undead](/Undead "Undead") ([Ghoul](/Ghoul "Ghoul"), [Mummy](/Mummy "Mummy"), bloodless [Vampire](/Vampire "Vampire"), [lichform](/Lichform "Lichform")) and [nonliving](/Nonliving "Nonliving") ([Gargoyle](/Gargoyle "Gargoyle"), [Djinn](/Djinn "Djinn"), [Statue Form](/Statue_Form "Statue Form"), [Storm Form](/Storm_Form "Storm Form"), [Wisp Form](/Wisp_Form "Wisp Form")) creatures are immune to sickness.
- [Miasma](/Miasma "Miasma") immunity confers immunity to sickness. This includes [demonspawn](/Demonspawn "Demonspawn") with the [Foul Stench](/Foul_Stench "Foul Stench") mutation, and players in [Shadow Form](/Shadow_Form "Shadow Form").
- [Zin](/Zin "Zin")'s Vitalisation provides temporary immunity (but does not cure existing sickness).

**Curing**

- Quaffing a [potion of cancellation](/Potion_of_cancellation "Potion of cancellation") cures sickness.
- [Elyvilon](/Elyvilon "Elyvilon")'s Purification also cures sickness.

## History

- Prior to [0.28](/0.28 "0.28"), the status changed colour depending on remaining duration (red -> pink -> yellow).
- Prior to [0.27](/0.27 "0.27"), sickness was cured by drinking a [potion of curing](/Potion_of_curing "Potion of curing") instead of a potion of cancellation. Also, increased regeneration rates would cause it to wear off more quickly.
- Prior to [0.26](/0.26 "0.26"), sickness healed slower if hungry.
- Prior to [0.19](/0.19 "0.19"), sickness had a chance to cause a single point of temporary [stat](/Stat "Stat") damage.
- Prior to [0.17](/0.17 "0.17"), casting [Haunt](/Haunt "Haunt") could inflict sickness.
- Prior to [0.15](/0.15 "0.15"), [Kobolds](/Kobold "Kobold") would recover from sickness more quickly than other species.
- Prior to [0.13](/0.13 "0.13"), sickness was one of the many unique [needle](/Needle "Needle") [brands](/Brand "Brand").
- Prior to [0.10](/0.10 "0.10"), eating contaminated [chunks](/Chunk "Chunk") would occasionally cause you to become sick. [Saprovores](/Saprovore "Saprovore") were partially protected from this. In [0.13](/0.13 "0.13"), [nausea](/Nausea "Nausea") was introduced as an intermediate step between health and sickness. Eating food while nauseous would occasionally induce sickness, but had few downsides on its own.
html:
Sickness

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.30: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.
You have been sickened, and your health will no longer regenerate.

Sickness is a status effect that prevents characters from naturally regenerating HP until it wears off. It does not affect Trog's Hand, Jiyva regeneration, or ambrosia. Other, non-regeneration sources of healing work normally.

Sources

  • Being within line of sight of an ancient zyme.

Dealing with

Immunity

  • Undead (Ghoul, Mummy, bloodless Vampire, lichform) and nonliving (Gargoyle, Djinn, Statue Form, Storm Form, Wisp Form) creatures are immune to sickness.
  • Miasma immunity confers immunity to sickness. This includes demonspawn with the Foul Stench mutation, and players in Shadow Form.
  • Zin's Vitalisation provides temporary immunity (but does not cure existing sickness).

Curing

  • Quaffing a potion of cancellation cures sickness.
  • Elyvilon's Purification also cures sickness.

History

  • Prior to 0.28, the status changed colour depending on remaining duration (red -> pink -> yellow).
  • Prior to 0.27, sickness was cured by drinking a potion of curing instead of a potion of cancellation. Also, increased regeneration rates would cause it to wear off more quickly.
  • Prior to 0.26, sickness healed slower if hungry.
  • Prior to 0.19, sickness had a chance to cause a single point of temporary stat damage.
  • Prior to 0.17, casting Haunt could inflict sickness.
  • Prior to 0.15, Kobolds would recover from sickness more quickly than other species.
  • Prior to 0.13, sickness was one of the many unique needle brands.
  • Prior to 0.10, eating contaminated chunks would occasionally cause you to become sick. Saprovores were partially protected from this. In 0.13, nausea was introduced as an intermediate step between health and sickness. Eating food while nauseous would occasionally induce sickness, but had few downsides on its own.
Retrieved from "http://crawl.chaosforge.org/index.php?title=Sickness&oldid=74908"

rawPage:
{{version030}}
{{flavour|You have been sickened, and your health will no longer regenerate.}}
'''Sickness''' is a [[status effect]] that prevents characters from naturally regenerating [[HP]] until it wears off. It does not affect [[Trog]]'s Hand, [[Jiyva]] regeneration, or [[ambrosia]]. Other, non-regeneration sources of healing work normally.

==Sources==
*Being within [[line of sight]] of an [[ancient zyme]].

==Dealing with==
'''Immunity'''
*[[Undead]] ([[Ghoul]], [[Mummy]], bloodless [[Vampire]], [[lichform]]) and [[nonliving]] ([[Gargoyle]], [[Djinn]], [[Statue Form]], [[Storm Form]], [[Wisp Form]]) creatures are immune to sickness.
*[[Miasma]] immunity confers immunity to sickness. This includes [[demonspawn]] with the [[Foul Stench]] mutation, and players in [[Shadow Form]].
*[[Zin]]'s Vitalisation provides temporary immunity (but does not cure existing sickness).

'''Curing'''
*Quaffing a [[potion of cancellation]] cures sickness.
*[[Elyvilon]]'s Purification also cures sickness.

==History==
*Prior to [[0.28]], the status changed colour depending on remaining duration (red -> pink -> yellow).
*Prior to [[0.27]], sickness was cured by drinking a [[potion of curing]] instead of a potion of cancellation. Also, increased regeneration rates would cause it to wear off more quickly.
*Prior to [[0.26]], sickness healed slower if hungry.
*Prior to [[0.19]], sickness had a chance to cause a single point of temporary [[stat]] damage.
*Prior to [[0.17]], casting [[Haunt]] could inflict sickness.
*Prior to [[0.15]], [[Kobold]]s would recover from sickness more quickly than other species.
*Prior to [[0.13]], sickness was one of the many unique [[needle]] [[brand]]s.
*Prior to [[0.10]], eating contaminated [[chunk]]s would occasionally cause you to become sick. [[Saprovore]]s were partially protected from this. In [[0.13]], [[nausea]] was introduced as an intermediate step between health and sickness. Eating food while nauseous would occasionally induce sickness, but had few downsides on its own.

[[Category:Status effects]]
